content:
Adding a column to track the property manager or contact person is a great idea. Here's an updated template for the Property List sheet:

**Sheet 1: Property List**

| Property ID | Property Address | Location | Acquisition Date | Purchase Price | Current Value | Property Type | Current Status | Property Manager/Contact |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | 123 Main St | City, State | 01/01/2020 | $100,000 | $120,000 | Residential | Active | John Smith |
| 2 | 456 Elm St | City, State | 06/01/2018 | $50,000 | $60,000 | Commercial | Under Construction | Jane Doe |
| 3 | 789 Oak St | City, State | 03/01/2015 | $200,000 | $250,000 | Vacant Land | Vacant | Bob Johnson |

You can add a new column with the header "Property Manager/Contact" and populate it with the name and contact information of the person responsible for each property. This could be a property manager, a real estate agent, a contractor, or any other person who is responsible for overseeing the property.

Tips for using this column:

* Consider adding a separate column for "Contact Information" to store additional contact details such as phone numbers, email addresses, or physical addresses.
* Use a drop-down menu or data validation to restrict the input to a pre-defined list of property managers or contacts.
* Use filters or pivot tables to analyze your property portfolio by property manager or contact, allowing you to identify trends, opportunities, or areas for improvement.
* Use conditional formatting to highlight properties with a specific property manager or contact, to quickly identify properties that require attention.

You can also use this column to:

* Assign responsibilities and tasks to specific property managers or contacts
* Track communication and interactions with property managers or contacts
* Identify areas where you need to adjust your management or investment strategy
* Monitor the performance of property managers or contacts and make data-driven decisions

Remember to update any formulas or reports that reference the Property List sheet to include the new Property Manager/Contact column.

Additionally, you can also consider adding more columns to track other relevant information such as:

* Property Manager/Contact Email
* Property Manager/Contact Phone
* Property Manager/Contact Address
* Property Manager/Contact Notes

This will help you to have a more comprehensive view of your property portfolio and make it easier to manage and track your properties.
